channel.title: Comments on: Converting Columns To Date From Datetime Does Not Result In A Scan In SQL Server 2008
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Dave I fixed it, it was a smart quotes plugin that caused it
item.content:encoded: Dave I fixed it, it was a smart quotes plugin that caused it

item.title: By: Dave
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description: I just wanted to point out that when using the Select All option to copy and paste into SQL Management Studio, the " ' " around the date is not correct for some reason. Just wanted to let you know.
item.content:encoded: I just wanted to point out that when using the Select All option to copy and paste into SQL Management Studio, the ” ‘ ” around the date is not correct for some reason. Just wanted to let you know.

item.title: By: Pythian Group Blog

item.description: <strong>Log Buffer #108: A Carnival of the Vanities for DBAs</strong><br />Welcome to the 108th edition of Log Buffer, the weekly review of database blogs.<br /> With almost no ado at all, let’s begin with the bad news–from StatisticsIO and Jason Massie: The Death of the DBA. And who is the perpetrator of this crime? ...
item.content:encoded:
Log Buffer #108: A Carnival of the Vanities for DBAs
Welcome to the 108th edition of Log Buffer, the weekly review of database blogs.
With almost no ado at all, let’s begin with the bad news–from StatisticsIO and Jason Massie: The Death of the DBA. And who is the perpetrator of this crime? …
